title: Stack ADT Basics
content: A stack is a linear data structure that follows the LIFO (Last-In, First-Out) principle. Main operations are push, pop, and peek.

title: Queue Applications
content: Queues are used in CPU scheduling, handling interrupts, and in networking for managing data packets.

title: Propositional Logic
content: Focus on truth tables and logical equivalences like De Morgan's laws.
